cip.render.raytrace.interfaces

Interface IRtD

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Blinn, Gaussian, Phong, TrowRietz

    public interface IRtD
    This is the interface to the slope distribution functions used in illumination models. The slope distribution function is a model of the roughness of the surface that predicts how much of the light received from one direction will be reflected in another direction as a result of surface roughness only.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float evaluate(Vector3f N, Vector3f H, Vector3f V, Vector3f L)
      Evaluate the slope-distribution function.
      void initialize(AngleF aBeta)
      The slope distibution is initialized from the angle beta that represents the angle between N and H at which the function drops to half the value of when N = H.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(AngleF aBeta)
        The slope distibution is initialized from the angle beta that represents the angle between N and H at which the function drops to half the value of when N = H.
        Parameters:
        aBeta - The angle at which the function drops to half its maximum value.

      • evaluate

        float evaluate(Vector3f N,
               Vector3f H,
               Vector3f V,
               Vector3f L)
        Evaluate the slope-distribution function. Most functions use only N and H for the evaluation, however V and L are required for the historically maintained, but seldom used Phong model. I've not found that passing everything represents a neglibible performance penalty, so I use this most general set of arguments.
        Parameters:
        N - The surface normal.
        H - The normalized bisector between V and L.
        V - The view or eye vector.
        L - The light vector.
        Returns:
        The value of the slope distribution function.
